intro: Eriospermum burchellii, commonly known as the woolly eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. The seeds are enclosed in a distinctive, spiky capsule that aids in seed dispersal.
